      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float calculatePriceOfBOM(BillOfMaterials bom)
      Communicates with the Data layer to gather information about a bill of materials in order to calculate the total cost of the entire carport.
      List<String> convertBillToStringList(BillOfMaterials bom)
      Receives a bill of material object consisting of a HashMap containing the IDs (key) of the Components it contains as well as the amount (value), and formats them into usable Strings that can be used for presentation.
      List<String> convertBillToStringList(Map<Component,Integer> bom)
      Receives a HashMap and formats it into usable Strings that can be used for presentation.
      Map<Component,Integer> convertBOMMap(BillOfMaterials bom)
      Receives a bill of material object consisting of a HashMap containing the IDs (key) of the Components it contains as well as the amount (value), then converts these integers into a new HashMap containing actual DTOs of these Components (as well as the amount).

        public Customer getCustomer(String email,
                            String password)
                     throws DataException
        Retrieves a Customer from the database consisting with the provided email address and password. This overload is used specifically for login functions.
        Parameters:
        email - the email of the Customer logging in
        password - the password of the Customer logging in
        Returns:
        a Customer DTO Java object
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer

      • updateCustomer

        public void updateCustomer(Customer customer,
                           Customer newCustomer)
                    throws DataException
        Updates a Customer in the database with a provided Customer DTO object. This method basically overrides everything but the id column of an entry. If the objects share an id the same object can be used as both parameters.
        Parameters:
        customer - the old Customer entry that needs to be updated
        newCustomer - the new Customer DTO Java object to override with
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer

      • generatePDFFromOrder

        public void generatePDFFromOrder(Order order,
                                 String filePath)
                          throws DataException,
                                 LogicException
        Saves a complete PDF file to a specified path.
        Parameters:
        order - the order to which the PDF is associated
        filePath - the path to save the PDF file
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer
        LogicException - if an error occurs in the logic layer

      • createOrder

        public Order createOrder(Customer customer,
                         String customerAddress,
                         int roofTypeId,
                         int carportLength,
                         int carportWidth,
                         int carportHeight,
                         int shedLength,
                         int shedWidth,
                         int shedHeight,
                         String filePath,
                         String caseMessage)
                  throws DataException,
                         LogicException
        Creates and persist an entire order as well as all objects related to said order both as Java objects and as entries in the database. Requires a Customer object, presumably from whomever is currently logged in. Also generates and saves a PDF file containing the bill of materials. Finally this method creates a Case in the database to attach the order to. The entire list of entries getting persisted to the database: Carport, Roof, BillOfMaterials (calculated and written to PDF), Order (with totalPriceCalculation) and lastly case.
        Parameters:
        customer - the Customer to whom the order should be attached
        customerAddress - the address of said customer
        roofTypeId - the id of the type of roof selected
        carportLength -
        carportWidth -
        carportHeight -
        shedLength - 0 if no shed is chosen
        shedWidth - 0 if no shed is chosen
        shedHeight - 0 if no shed is chosen
        filePath - the path to the location the PDF is saved
        caseMessage - the message to attach to the case this order is created for
        Returns:
        the Order object created
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer
        LogicException - if an error occurs in the logic layer

      • markOrderAsSent

        public void markOrderAsSent(int orderId)
                     throws DataException
        Updates an Order instance in the database to be marked as sent. Also provides the current date as the sending date.
        Parameters:
        orderId - the id of the order to update
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer

      • updateBOM

        public void updateBOM(BillOfMaterials BOM,
                      BillOfMaterials newBOM)
               throws DataException
        Updates a Bill in the database with a provided BillOfMaterials DTO object. This method basically overrides everything but the id column of an entry. If the objects share an id the same object can be used as both parameters.
        Parameters:
        BOM - the old Bill entry that needs to be updated
        newBOM - the new BillOfMaterials DTO Java object to override with
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer

      • generateBOM

        public BillOfMaterials generateBOM(int orderId,
                                   Carport carport,
                                   Roof roof)
                            throws DataException
        Communicates with the Data layer to gather information about an order in order to calculate, create and persist a bill of materials to the DB.
        Parameters:
        orderId - the id of the order whose bill needs to be persisted
        carport -
        roof -
        Returns:
        the BillOfMaterial object that is also being generated in the DB
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer

      • calculatePriceOfBOM

        public float calculatePriceOfBOM(BillOfMaterials bom)
                          throws DataException,
                                 LogicException
        Communicates with the Data layer to gather information about a bill of materials in order to calculate the total cost of the entire carport.
        Parameters:
        bom - the BillOfMaterials object to calculate
        Returns:
        a float value of the total cost of an entire bill
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer
        LogicException - if an error occurs in the logic layer

      • convertBOMMap

        public Map<Component,Integer> convertBOMMap(BillOfMaterials bom)
                                     throws DataException,
                                            LogicException
        Receives a bill of material object consisting of a HashMap containing the IDs (key) of the Components it contains as well as the amount (value), then converts these integers into a new HashMap containing actual DTOs of these Components (as well as the amount).
        Parameters:
        bom - the bill of material object to convert into a usable Map
        Returns:
        a Map that is easier to use in presentation
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer
        LogicException - if an error occurs in the logic layer

      • convertBillToStringList

        public List<String> convertBillToStringList(Map<Component,Integer> bom)
                                     throws PDFException
        Receives a HashMap and formats it into usable Strings that can be used for presentation. Includes commas in float numbers and trimming zeroes as well as adding m. and kr. where applicable.
        Parameters:
        bom - the Map from which to extract data
        Returns:
        an List of Strings formatted to be presented
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • convertBillToStringList

        public List<String> convertBillToStringList(BillOfMaterials bom)
                                     throws DataException,
                                            LogicException,
                                            PDFException
        Receives a bill of material object consisting of a HashMap containing the IDs (key) of the Components it contains as well as the amount (value), and formats them into usable Strings that can be used for presentation. Includes commas in float numbers and trimming zeroes as well as adding m/mm and kr. where applicable.
        Parameters:
        bom - the BillOfMaterials object to convert
        Returns:
        an List of Strings formatted to be presented
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer
        LogicException - if an error occurs in the logic layer
        PDFException - if an error occurs during the generation of the PDF

      • generatePDFFromBill

        public void generatePDFFromBill(Map<Component,Integer> bom,
                                String author,
                                String fileName,
                                String filePath)
                         throws LogicException
        Saves a complete PDF file from a bill of materials map.
        Parameters:
        bom - the Bill of Materials Map containing the data required
        author - the author of the document; ie. the person generating it
        fileName - the name to save the file as
        filePath - the path to save the file to
        Throws:
        LogicException - if an error occurs in the logic layer

      • updateComponent

        public void updateComponent(Component Component,
                            Component newComponent)
                     throws DataException
        Updates a Component in the database with a provided Component DTO object. This method basically overrides everything but the id column of an entry. If the objects share an id the same object can be used as both parameters.
        Parameters:
        Component - the old Component entry that needs to be updated
        newComponent - the new Component DTO Java object to override with
        Throws:
        DataException - if an error occurs in the data layer
